intro: Cavendishia lebroniae, commonly known as the Lebronia's Cavendish, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Bromeliaceae family and is characterized by its striking, colorful inflorescences. The plant typically grows as an epiphyte, attaching itself to trees in humid tropical environments. Its leaves are often arranged in a rosette pattern, forming a central cup that collects rainwater. Due to its ornamental value, it is cultivated in botanical gardens and by plant enthusiasts.
